header.title: MAM Subscriptions
header.abstract: Allow entities to subscribe to message archives in order to keep updated and engaged in a converstation.

section1.p: This extension of &xep0313; allows entities to subscribe to message archives, removing the need for &xep0280;.
An entity advertises support for this protocol by including the "urn:xmpp:mam:sub:0" feature in its service discovery information features as specified in &xep0030;.

example.caption: Client requests information about its own server

section1.example: <iq xmlns='jabber:client' from='montague.example' id='info1' to='romeo@montague.example/garden' type='result'> <query xmlns='http://jabber.org/protocol/disco#info'> ... <feature var='urn:xmpp:mam:sub:0'/> ... </query> </iq>

example.caption: Client subscribes to the message archive
Client unsubscribes to the message archive

section1.p: Each notification is wrapped using &xep0297; (TODO or not?), containing a "message-id" extension as specified in XEP-MID.

example.caption: Server sends carbon to Romeo's other clients

section1.example: <message xmlns='jabber:client' from='romeo@montague.example' to='romeo@montague.example/home' type='chat'> <mamsub xmlns='urn:xmpp:mam:sub:0'> <forwarded xmlns='urn:xmpp:forward:0'> <message xmlns='jabber:client' from='juliet@capulet.example/balcony' to='romeo@montague.example/garden' type='chat'> <body>What man art thou that, thus bescreen'd in night, so stumblest on my counsel?</body> <thread>0e3141cd80894871a68e6fe6b1ec56fa</thread> <messsage-id xmlns='urn:xmpp:mid:0' id='de305d54-75b4-431b-adb2-eb6b9e546013'/> </message> </forwarded> </mamsub> </message>
